etymology.description: pictogram of a long river with tributaries; alternatively, a person swimming in water; cognate with 𠂢, 派; original form of 泳.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts flowing water with branching streams or a swimmer moving through water, evoking continuity and unending motion. The watery sense later split: 泳 came to mean “to swim,” while 永 specialized to the idea of permanence and eternity.

examples.chinese: 我们永不放弃(我們永不放棄)。
他发誓永远记得这一天(他發誓永遠記得這一天)。
examples.pinyin: Tā fāshì yǒngyuǎn jìde zhè yì tiān.
examples.english: He swore to remember this day forever.

examples.chinese: 河水绵延不绝(河水綿延不絕)，象征永恒(象徵永恆)。
examples.pinyin: Héshuǐ miányán bù jué, xiàngzhēng yǒnghéng.
examples.english: The river flows on without end, symbolizing eternity.
